description: Remove the personal token input section from the UI. Implement pre-configured GitHub token in config to allow public users to collaborate. Token should be stored securely in environment variables for GitHub Pages deployment.

task_name: Update Task Form with All Required Fields
description: Add form inputs for all non-automatable task fields from template schema. Include fields for: task_name, description, status, priority, start_date, end_date, estimated_hours, category_name, tags, assigned_workers, dependencies, parent_task_id, is_critical_path. Auto-populate task_id, created_date, and creator_id.

Enhance template-automation.js to automatically populate task_id, created_date, creator_id, and other automatable fields. Ensure validation happens before task creation. Support status normalization and default values from TEMPLATE_CONFIG.

Implement parent_task_id functionality to enable subtask creation. Update the UI to show parent-child relationships and support creating subtasks from task detail view. Ensure dependencies work correctly with subtasks.
Add UI controls for defining task dependencies with types (FS, SS, FF, SF) and lag_days. Implement critical path visualization. Validate dependency chains to prevent circular dependencies.

Add user name input for public collaborators. Implement comment system on tasks. Add worker assignment without authentication. Enable status updates and progress tracking for all users. Show who made changes and when.
Comprehensive testing of task creation flow with all field types. Verify auto-population of task_id, dates, and creator. Test validation error messages. Test with various input combinations.

Create comprehensive documentation for public users on how to use the task manager. Include examples of creating tasks, managing dependencies, setting status, and collaborating. Add developer setup guide for GitHub Pages deployment.
Setup GitHub Actions workflow to deploy the task manager to GitHub Pages. Configure environment variables for GitHub token. Test public access and collaboration features on live deployment.
Conduct project retrospective to review what went well, what could be improved, and lessons learned. Document findings and create improvement tasks for next iteration.

task_name: Stabilize Local Dev & E2E Test Setup
description: Fix local dev/test issues: make token loading safe when no injected variable exists, point the app to the deployed tasks database file, and stabilize Playwright to run locally without hitting production.
Update /public/tasksDB/tasks.csv so it reflects the same project state as /public/tasksDB/tasks.json (statuses, dates, and any newly added tasks).
Confirm the intended security model for public collaboration (token injection, permissions/scoping, abuse prevention). Document the approach and constraints in README/tools docs.
Preserve the older repo-root tasks.json as an immutable history snapshot under /public/tasksDB/history without changing the canonical runtime database.
Make the dashboard stat cards clickable so users can quickly filter tasks by status (All, Not Started, In Progress, Completed).

Implement a simple password gate for all modification actions (create, edit, delete tasks). Users can view tasks and dashboard freely, but must enter a shared password before making changes. GitHub Pages uses a repo Secret injected at deploy time; local dev is unlocked by default.

Add a visual timeline/Gantt-style view showing tasks on a date axis. Display task start/end dates, status colors, dependencies as connecting lines. Allow toggle between list view and timeline view. Show clear distinction between completed and pending tasks.

Two-way sync between tasks and GitHub Issues. Create issues from tasks, import issues as tasks. Keep status synchronized. Show issue number and link on task cards. Use GitHub API to read/write issues.

Create Playwright E2E tests for: 1) Password protection flow (blocked without password, allowed with password), 2) Timeline view rendering and interaction, 3) GitHub Issues sync operations. Test locally before deploying.
